rules: Rule1: If it is not the case that (furniture prototype_A has been produced, or it is not the case that (if the game for prototype_B is approved then the legislation is not amended) implies the designer has a job interview), then the designer secures a job.
Rule2: Whenever production of prototype_A is halted, it is not the case that furniture prototype_A has been produced.
Rule3: Either production of prototype_A is halted or production of prototype_A is delayed.
Rule4: If there was an equipment failure for prototype_A, then, provided that production is delayed, furniture prototype_A is not produced.
Rule5: There was an equipment failure for prototype_A or there is a supply shortage for prototype_A.
Rule6: Given that there is a supply shortage for prototype_A, then if production is delayed, furniture prototype_A is not produced.
Rule7: Whenever furniture prototype_C has been designed, prototype_C complies with the legislation.
Rule8: Provided that the game for prototype_A is approved, then if furniture prototype_A has been designed, it will be marketed.
Rule9: The game for prototype_A is approved or prototype_A complies with the legislation.
Rule10: In the event that prototype_C complies with the legislation, the game for prototype_C is approved.
Rule11: Assuming the patent for prototype_A is licensed, then if the game is patented, and if the furniture is designed, then the furniture is marketed.
Rule12: The patent for prototype_A is licensed or the patent for prototype_A is open source.
Rule13: In the event that the designer appeals the fine, then if the designer is fined, the designer is not promoted.
Rule14: The designer appeals the fine or the designer pays the fine.
Rule15: Under the condition that the designer pays the fine, then if the designer is fined, the designer is not promoted.
Rule16: Whenever prototype_A complies with the legislation, the game for prototype_A is patented.
Rule17: If the game for prototype_B is modified, then if it is not the case that (if the game violates legislation then the designer does not lose their job) implies a job is offered to the designer.
Rule18: The legislation concerning prototype_B is amended, or if the game for prototype_B violates the legislation, then the designer does not lose their job.
Rule19: If it is not the case that (if furniture prototype_A is designed then it is marketed), then furniture prototype_C is designed.
Rule20: Provided that it is not the case that (if the game for prototype_B is approved then the legislation is not amended), the designer does not have a job interview.

Rule21: In the event that it is not the case that (if the patent for prototype_A is open source then, if the game is patented and the furniture is designed, the furniture is marketed), the designer is promoted.
Rule22: Assuming it is not the case that (if the patent for prototype_A is open source then, if the game is patented and the furniture is designed, the furniture is marketed), the designer is fined.
Rule23: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if prototype_A complies with legislation and the furniture is designed, then the furniture is marketed), the designer loses their job.

Rule24: Whenever it is not the case that (if it is not the case that (if the game for prototype_B is approved then the legislation is not amended) then the designer has a job interview), it is not the case that the designer secures a job.
Rule25: Given that the game for prototype_B is not modified, the designer refuses the job.
facts: Fact1: Furniture prototype_A has been designed.
Fact2: The game for prototype_B has been approved.
Fact3: The game for prototype_B violates the legislation.
Fact4: The game for prototype_C is not approved.
Fact5: A job has not been offered to the designer.
Fact6: The designer has not refused the job.
